title: 'I learned from it': Jason Pierre-Paul opens up about fireworks incident that cost him his fingers 10 years ago
description: Pierre-Paul is still training to play despite not being with a team in 2024.
author: Jordan Raanan

title: Source: Liverpool players to attend Jota's funeral
description: Diogo Jota's Liverpool teammates will attend the funeral of the 28-year-old and his brother André Silva in Portugal on Saturday, a source told ESPN.
author: Mark Ogden

title: 'Hard to take' but Raducanu draws confidence from defeat
description: After pushing world number one Aryna Sabalenka at Wimbledon, British number one Emma Raducanu draws confidence despite defeat.

title: Why Smith could become England's greatest keeper-batter
description: Why Jamie Smith's assault on India's bowlers marks him out as a future England great.

title: 'We can definitely dream' - Hamilton upbeat as McLaren talk up Ferrari threat
description: Lewis Hamilton says Ferrari "can definitely dream" after a "really positive" Friday at the British Grand Prix.

title: Smith, Brook launch stirring England fightback but India still well on top
description: Jamie Smith hit the highest score by an England Test wicketkeeper and threatened to smoke the team's fastest ton as he and Harry Brook led a stirring fightback against India - although the tourists remain in firm control at Edgbaston after a pulsating day three.

title: Gymnast Livvy Dunne Shares Revealing Video on the Serious Injuries she has Endured
description: Livvy Dunne sheds light on the pain behind the performance in gymnastics.

title: Jeff McNeil's home run and sparkling defensive play carry Mets past Yankees in Subway Series
description: Jeff McNeil, arms clasped behind his back, tossed his bat and shouted toward the New York Mets dugout, starting up the first base line as his go-ahead, two-run homer in the seventh inning off Luke Weaver sailed into the second deck at Citi Field. McNeil popped to his feet and threw to first for the second out of the ninth. “The homer was sick,” McNeil said after the Mets overcame a pair of two-run deficits to beat the New York Yankees 6-5 on Friday in the opener of this season's second Subway Series.
author: RONALD BLUM
